name: Panama
description: Panama, a narrow nation bordering both the Caribbean Sea and the Pacific Ocean, is renowned for its strategic location, the Panama Canal, and its incredible biodiversity.  It boasts a diverse landscape ranging from lush rainforests and towering mountains to pristine beaches and arid plains.  A blend of indigenous, African, and European cultures contributes to a vibrant and unique national identity.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city, a major economic and cultural hub.
quickFacts.detail: Located on the Pacific coast, Panama City is a modern metropolis with a rich colonial history.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A growing population with a diverse ethnic makeup.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population identifies as mixed indigenous and European descent.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Relatively small but incredibly diverse in terms of geography.
quickFacts.detail: Panama is the eighth-smallest country in Latin America.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The primary language spoken throughout the country.
quickFacts.detail: Indigenous languages are also spoken in certain regions.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The US dollar is widely accepted and used in commerce.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: A growing economy driven by tourism, finance, and canal operations.
quickFacts.detail: Panama's economy is heavily reliant on the Panama Canal.

climateData.title: Panama's Climate
climateData.description: Panama experiences a tropical climate with significant regional variations. The Caribbean side is generally warmer and more humid than the Pacific side. Rainfall is abundant throughout the year, with distinct wet and dry seasons.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season is characterized by sunny skies, low humidity, and minimal rainfall. It's the most popular time to visit.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings frequent showers and higher humidity. While rain is common, it often occurs in short bursts.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Hurricane Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Panama is susceptible to hurricanes during this period. Travelers should monitor weather forecasts and be prepared for potential disruptions.

naturalWonders.name: San Blas Islands
naturalWonders.description: A stunning archipelago of over 365 islands and cays, inhabited by the indigenous Kuna people. Known for its pristine beaches, turquoise waters, and vibrant coral reefs.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The islands offer a unique cultural experience and unparalleled opportunities for snorkeling, diving, and relaxation.  The Kuna people maintain their traditional way of life, welcoming visitors with open arms.

naturalWonders.name: Soñé Rainforest
naturalWonders.description: A pristine rainforest teeming with biodiversity, home to numerous endemic species and ancient trees.  It's a vital carbon sink and a crucial habitat for wildlife.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Soñé is one of the most biologically diverse areas in the world.  Its dense vegetation and challenging terrain make it a rewarding destination for experienced hikers and nature enthusiasts.

naturalWonders.name: Barú National Park
naturalWonders.description: Located in the highlands of Panama, Barú National Park is home to the highest peak in the country, Volcán Barú, and offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park encompasses a diverse range of ecosystems, including cloud forests, paramo grasslands, and alpine tundra. It's a popular destination for hiking, birdwatching, and wildlife observation.

ecosystemData.title: Panama's Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Panama’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from tropical rainforests to coral reefs and cloud forests. These ecosystems are vital for the country’s biodiversity and provide essential services such as carbon sequestration and water regulation.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Panama is a birdwatcher’s paradise, boasting over 900 species of birds, including numerous endemic and migratory species.

statistics.details: Many bird species are found only in Panama.
Panama is a key stopover for migratory birds.

notableSpecies.name: Resplendent Quetzal
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of Panama and a globally recognized bird of beauty.

notableSpecies.name: Bare-throated Tiger-Heron
notableSpecies.significance: A critically endangered heron found only in Panama.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: Panama is home to a variety of mammals, including jaguars, sloths, monkeys, and tapirs.

statistics.details: Several mammal species are threatened by habitat loss and poaching.
Unique mammal species are found only in Panama.

notableSpecies.name: Jaguar
notableSpecies.significance: The largest cat in the Americas.

notableSpecies.name: Panama Tapir
notableSpecies.significance: A large, herbivorous mammal found in rainforests.

biodiversityCategories.name: Reptiles & Amphibians
biodiversityCategories.description: Panama has a rich diversity of reptiles and amphibians, including colorful frogs, snakes, and lizards.

statistics.details: Many reptile and amphibian species are found only in Panama.
Several species are threatened by habitat loss and climate change.

notableSpecies.name: Poison Dart Frogs
notableSpecies.significance: Known for their vibrant colors and potent toxins.

notableSpecies.name: Green Tree Python
notableSpecies.significance: A large, arboreal python found in rainforests.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Panama
activities.description: Panama offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from hiking and birdwatching to water sports and adventure tours.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Panama’s diverse landscapes on foot, from rainforest trails to mountain peaks.

activities.name: Soñé Rainforest Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek through the heart of the Soñé Rainforest, offering opportunities to spot wildlife and experience the rainforest’s beauty.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, rain gear, insect repellent

activities.name: Pipeline Trail
activities.description: A strenuous hike through the Darién Gap, offering stunning views of the Pacific coast.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, plenty of water, navigation skills

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy Panama’s beautiful coastline with a variety of water sports activities.

activities.name: Scuba Diving in Bocas del Toro
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and diverse marine life of Bocas del Toro.

activities.name: Surfing in Santa Catalina
activities.description: Catch some waves at Santa Catalina, a popular surfing destination.

clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, rain jacket, sweater, long pants

equipment.basic: Backpack, water bottle, flashlight, first-aid kit
equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
